items.title: Engelsman is verrassende opvolger van Kluivert bij IndonesiÃ«
items.summary: John Herdman is de nieuwe bondscoach van IndonesiÃ«. Dat maakte voetbalbond PSSI zaterdagmorgen bekend. De Engelsman is de opvolger van Patrick Kluivert.

items.title: 'Sergio Ramos brengt fors bod uit op jeugdliefde Sevilla'
items.summary: Sergio Ramos (39) heeft een officieel bod uitgebracht op de aandelen van Sevilla. Dat meldt het Spaanse COPE . Volgens het medium is de voormalige verdediger van de club serieus in de race om eigenaar te worden.

items.title: Swiatek: Women's tennis does not need 'Battle of the Sexes'
items.summary: Iga Swiatek says women's tennis does not need the 'Battle of the Sexes' and is able to "stand on its own".

items.title: Najaarskampioen Lens wint zeven keer op rij maar vreest voor 2002-scenario
items.summary: RC Lens won vrijdagvond met 0-3 bij Toulouse en mocht zich daardoor najaarskampioen van Frankrijk noemen. De voorsprong op titelfavoriet Paris Saint-Germain is vier punten, al hebben de Parijzenaren nog een wedstrijd tegoed. Bij Lens vrezen ze voor een scenario uit het verleden, al geven de data meer reden tot hoop.

items.title: Bethell: Why I want to bat at No 3 and how IPL made me a better player
items.summary: Jacob Bethell explained why he wants to bat at No 3 for England and how the IPL made him a better player as he sat down with Sky Sportsâ€™ Nasser Hussain ahead of the final Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: Arteta over bankzitter Eze: 'Heeft meer minuten gespeeld dan ooit'
items.summary: Arsenal-manager Mikel Arteta verbaasde zich op de persconferentie over de vragen rondom Eberechi Eze. De jonge middenvelder bleef de afgelopen twee wedstrijden steeds negentig minuten op de bank zitten, maar volgens de Spanjaard speelt Eze meer minuten dan hij ooit op het hoogste niveau heeft gedaan.

items.title: 'Van Hanegem en Mansveld waren bikkelhard, maar absolute wereldtop'
items.summary: Lex Schoenmaker (78) is nog altijd Europees topscorer van Feyenoord. De Haagse spits van weleer won met de club de UEFA Cup en maakte uiteindelijk negentien doelpunten in Europees verband. Met dank aan zijn grote vriend Willem van Hanegem.

items.title: Graduates reunited: Chelseaâ€™s former Manchester City talents return
items.summary: Palmer and Delap are among five academy players who learnt their trade at City, as links between the clubs grow Chelseaâ€™s visit to Manchester City on Sunday will be a homecoming for members of the travelling party. Five Chelsea players were nurtured at the academy that sits a few hundred yards from the Etihad Stadium, on the other side of a bridge. The London clubâ€™s recent recruitment has been heavily influenced by Cityâ€™s teaching of players and coaches. Tosin Adarabioyo, Cole Palmer, Liam Delap, Jamie Gittens and RomÃ©o Lavia were members of Cityâ€™s youth ranks, most working there under Enzo Maresca. If one thread was unpicked this week when Maresca dramatically departed Chelsea, the link remains strong because Sundayâ€™s caretaker, Calum McFarlane, was formerly the under-18s assistant manager at City. Continue reading...

items.title: Darts' new rivalry? Why Littler vs Veen final tonight is unmissable
items.summary: Just over two years ago, Luke Littler and Gian van Veen went head-to-head in the World Youth Championship final in a match that perhaps marked the start of a long, thrilling rivalry.

items.summary: We have a busy dayâ€™s racing on Saturday with action from Lingfield, Newcastle and Southwell live on Sky Sports Racing...

items.title: 'No coasting' and no selfishness from England in 'huge' final Ashes Test
items.summary: England captain Ben Stokes vowed there will be let up from his side in a "huge" final Ashes Test in Sydney as they aim to leave Australia with a narrow 3-2 defeat.

items.title: Blackburn to Barcelona - Dolan's 'unbelievable' journey
items.summary: Five years ago, Tyrhys Dolan was playing for Clitheroe - now he is preparing to face Barcelona in the Catalan derby.

items.title: Iâ€™m the â€˜miracleâ€™ woken from a coma by Kenny Dalglish after Hillsborough. And now Iâ€™ve met him again
items.summary: Itâ€™s said that you should never meet your heroes, but 36 years after the Liverpool manager sat by my hospital bed, I got to thank our greatest ally Born to a son of Anfield in a Warwickshire village, I grew up geographically remote from my spiritual football home. Emotionally, though, the pull of the boys in red was ever-present: from my first game at Anfield in 1974 to FA Cup final defeat at Wembley in â€™77, to witnessing the first of Liverpoolâ€™s six European Cups, in Rome, when my first hero, Kevin Keegan, ran Berti Vogts ragged. I cried when Keegan left, but soon a new king was born in my imagination: Kenny Dalglish, that wily, tough, insanely skilful Scot. I travelled the country to follow my team through the peaks and troughs that culminated in the lowest possible low, on 15 April 1989, the day of the FA Cup semi-final between Liverpool and Nottingham Forest. There are many things I remember about Hillsborough, some of which returned to me years, even decades, later. My dad saying: â€œIf itâ€™s a nice day tomorrow, weâ€™ll go.â€ Ian St John on the end of my hospital bed. My best mate laughing as I struggled to eat a yoghurt. The endless bright white lights of the Royal Hallamshire. The surreal trip to my local hospital in an ancient, drafty ambulance. One thing I donâ€™t remember, though, is meeting my hero. And for good reason. For Iâ€™m the â€œmiracleâ€ boy woken by the sound of Kennyâ€™s voice when he spoke at my bedside. Continue reading...

items.title: Sources: Rosenior frontrunner to replace Maresca
items.summary: Strasbourg boss Liam Rosenior is the leading candidate to succeed Enzo Maresca as Chelsea head coach, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Pep denies Maresca, City links: 'I have a contract'
items.summary: Pep Guardiola has reiterated his desire to stay on at Manchester City amid fresh rumours surrounding Enzo Maresca.

items.title: Neymar hint about next contract teased
items.summary: Santos have indicated that Neymar will be with the club until the end of the year.

items.title: Sources: Sterling keen on permanent Chelsea exit
items.summary: Raheem Sterling is prioritising a permanent move away from Chelsea this month amid interest from West Ham and Fulham, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Laurens' weekend preview: Maresca-less Chelsea visit Man City, Barcelona derby, more
items.summary: What is Julien Laurens watching this weekend? There's the start of the post-Maresca era at Chelsea as they head to Man City, huge derbies in Scotland and France, and much more.

items.title: Thomas Frank admits â€˜itâ€™s difficult to enjoyâ€™ being Tottenham head coach
items.summary: Frank likens challenges at Spurs to running a marathon Tottenham booed off after goalless draw at Brentford Thomas Frank has admitted he is not enjoying his job at Tottenham. The head coach is dealing with numerous problems as he navigates what always stood to be a transitional season, the most insistent being his teamâ€™s lack of creativity. Spurs were booed off after Thursdayâ€™s 0-0 draw at Brentford by the travelling support, who also chanted â€œboring, boring Tottenhamâ€. But Frank is confident he will come to look back on the first half of his debut campaign more fondly once â€“ and not if â€“ his squad emerges on the other side, stronger and wiser for the suffering. Tottenham are 12th in the Premier League â€“ their next game is at home to Sunderland on Sunday and Frank leant into a marathon-running analogy when he was asked whether he was enjoying the challenge to which he has signed up. Continue reading...
